de.hotware.hotsound.audio.data

Interface Audio

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    SeekableAudio
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseAudio, BasicPlaybackAudio, RecordAudio, WaveAudio

    public interface Audio
extends java.lang.AutoCloseable
    All Audio data is being read from subclasses of this interface.
    Author:
    Martin Braun

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Audio.AudioException

      closes the IAudios resources

      int read(byte[] pData, int pStart, int pLength)
      Reads up to a specified maximum number of bytes of data from the audio stream, putting them into the given byte array.

    • Method Detail

      • getAudioFormat

        javax.sound.sampled.AudioFormat getAudioFormat()
        Returns:
        the AudioFormat of the IAudio. doesn't throw exceptions!

      • read

        int read(byte[] pData,
       int pStart,
       int pLength)
         throws Audio.AudioException
        Reads up to a specified maximum number of bytes of data from the audio stream, putting them into the given byte array. This method will always read an integral number of frames. If pLength does not specify an integral number of frames, a maximum of len - (pLength % frameSize) bytes will be read.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if not opened yet
        Audio.AudioException

      • open

        void open()
          throws Audio.AudioException
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if opened while not being closed
        Audio.AudioException

      • isClosed

        boolean isClosed()

      • close

        void close()
           throws Audio.AudioException
        closes the IAudios resources
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        Audio.AudioException
